Message.Title: This should help Keystone pipeline approval
Message.Msg: Explosion Reported At Detroit Tar Sands Refinery Posted: 27 Apr 2013 04:36 PM PDT Another explosion, this time near Detroit: DETROIT (WWJ) – BREAKING – There has been an explosion at the Marathon Detroit Refinery and a mandatory evacuation order is in effect for the area just off of Schafer from Ropp down to Dix and all the way down to Outer Drive per Melvindale police. Reports of the explosion came in from several listeners to WWJ Newsradio 950 just before 6 p.m. and it appears that one of the tankers on the site may have exploded. Marathon Detroit Refinery told WWJ that they were trying to get the situation under control but could not comment further. The controversial site is a major destination for tar sands oil, and is in Michigan's single most polluted zip code: More recently, residents have been concerned about huge black piles appearing along the Detroit River. They're made up of a material known as petroleum coke, or petcoke, that originates from the Marathon facility and is being sold to a company called Koch Minerals LLC. Marathon said that since they do not own either the petcoke or the property where the mounds of the petcoke were dumped, they are not responsible for moving it. The Michigan Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) conducted tests on the petcoke, following concerns expressed by U.S. Reps. Gary Peters (D-Bloomfield Township) and John Conyers (D-Detroit), but found them not to be hazardous. Not satisfied with these results, State Rep. Rashida Tlaib (D-Detroit) collected samples for independent testing last month and is now waiting on the results. She's also concerned about the potential for polluted stormwater to flow into the Detroit River, although DEQ Water Resources Division spokesman Andrew Hartz told the Detroit News last week that the piles are being managed to prevent that sort of runoff. Petcoke may form combustible dust concentrations in air. Is this another case of unregulated industry go

Topic.Title: Finished any rands atlas shrugged

Message.Msg: Rand was a third-rate thinker and fifth-rate writer, and her many acolytes in the Republican Party crank out an inexhausti­ble supply of derivative gruel based her reed-thin philosophy­. The real irony is that such people long ago turned off the thinking part of their brains in exchange for her cartoonish­, paint-by-n­umbers world view. And each of these sad patsies regards himself as a "Great Man". Pathetic. "[The Native Americans] didn't have any rights to the land and there was no reason for anyone to grant them rights which they had not conceived and were not using.... What was it they were fighting for, if they opposed white men on this continent? For their wish to continue a primitive existence, their "right" to keep part of the earth untouched, unused and not even as property, just keep everybody out so that you will live practicall­y like an animal, or maybe a few caves above it. Any white person who brought the element of civilizati­on had the right to take over this continent.­" -- "Q and A session following her Address To The Graduating Class Of The United States Military Academy at West Point, New York, March 6, 1974" An interesting thing is happening right now around the GOP budget proposal. A broad coalition of religious voices is criticizing the morality of the choices reflected in budget cuts and tax policy. And they’ve specifically targeted Ryan and his praise for Rand, the philosopher who once said she “promote[d] the ethic of selfishness.”

Topic.Title: Poetic justice in Boston bombing, the libs got what the asked for by supporting terrorists

Message.Msg: Yes, people should be worried about terrorists. My condolences to all the people hurt or killed in Boston. However, outside of the 9/11 terrorist attack when Bush was president, the chances of being harmed by terrorists is extremely small. Being killed by terrorists should actually be the least of any person’s worries. People should be much more worried about NRA supported whackos who kill people doing normal activities such as walking on the streets, attending class, working in an office, or just watching a movie. The chances of being killed in such situations is thousands of times higher than being killed by terrorists. There is a lot of blood on the NRA who sees all these killings happen and yet they cannot even let a bill to tighten background checks to be passed.

Topic.Title: Hyper inflation starting

Message.Msg: The new clean coal from Ohio State doesn't even burn. There is no fly ash, and no clinkers. The reduction of these pollutants is all they need to expand use under current guidelines. Development will likely be impeded by chicken little and his band of "sky is falling" eco-nuts. They react it chemically. The current model is to use the heat from the reaction to fire a boiler. The CO2 can be fully captured, bringing it into compliance with future regulations. Did you know that the manufacture of ethanol creates additional carbon dioxide in the fermentation process? Even Algae emits carbon dioxide at night, as do all other bio-fuel plant sources. Plants absorb CO2 in the light cycle, and give some back in the dark cycle. Coal is being treated unfairly by the eco-nuts. This new technology cleans it up beyond any reasonable expectations.
